t: Jonah*p prayed to the Lord*s his God from the belly of the fish:
I*pn called to the Lord*s in my distress, and*ln he answered me. I*ln cried out for help from deep inside Sheol; you*ln heard my voice.
When*ln you threw me into the depths, into*ln the heart of the seas, the*ln current overcame me. All*ln your breakers and your billows swept over me.
And*ln I said, “I have been banished from*ln your sight, yet*ln I will look once more toward*ln your holy temple.”
The*ln water engulfed me up to the neck; the*ln watery depths overcame me; seaweed*ln was wrapped around my head.
I*ln sank to the foundations of the mountains, the*ln earth’s gates shut behind me forever! Then*ln you raised my life from the Pit, Lord*s my God!
As*ln my life was fading away, I*ln remembered the Lord,*s and*ln my prayer came to you, to*ln your holy temple.
Those*ln who cherish worthless idols abandon*ln their faithful love,
but*ln as for me, I will sacrifice to you with*ln a voice of thanksgiving. I*ln will fulfill what I have vowed. Salvation*ln belongs to the Lord.*s
Then*p the Lord*s commanded the fish, and it vomited Jonah onto dry land.
